alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 2:41AM MDT until August 21 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Bryce Canyon Country, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, recent burn scars, rivers, creeks, streams and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A renewed monsoonal surge combined with the lingering moisture from Hurricane Hilary will bring a continued threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Bryce Canyon Country, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall causing flash flooding of normally dry washes, recent burn scars, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ongoing monsoon surge combined with increasing tropical moisture will bring an increased threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park
